function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"High frequency of use in medical and health facilities can increase the risk of exposure to contagious diseases.","Impact":"Unmitigated exposure to contagious diseases can lead to outbreaks and public health crises.","Mitigation":"Encourage the use of non-contact medical services and virtual interactions to reduce physical visits to medical facilities.","Technologies":"Telemedicine platforms, remote consultations, and virtual communication tools.","People":"Residents, especially those living in densely populated areas with high usage of medical facilities.","Owner":"Local health authorities, community organizations, and healthcare providers."},{"Description":"Low satisfaction with non-contact interaction activities may deter people from adopting virtual services and continuing to use traditional medical facilities.","Impact":"Unwillingness to use non-contact services can lead to overcrowding and increased risk of exposure in physical medical facilities.","Mitigation":"Improving the quality and accessibility of non-contact services to increase user satisfaction and adoption.","Technologies":"User-friendly virtual platforms, reliable internet infrastructure, and intuitive online interfaces.","People":"Residents who rely on community service facilities and non-contact medical services.","Owner":"Technology providers, community organizations, and local government."},{"Description":"Unwillingness to continue using non-contact services post-epidemic can hinder the development of virtual community spaces and impede disease containment efforts.","Impact":"Reliance on traditional in-person services post-epidemic can perpetuate the risk of contagious disease spread in the community.","Mitigation":"Educating and incentivizing residents to embrace non-contact services for long-term community health and safety.","Technologies":"Digital education and awareness campaigns, incentives for virtual service adoption, and community engagement platforms.","People":"Residents and community service providers.","Owner":"Local government, community leaders, and public health agencies."}]}
